name: Bull City, NC Schools & Libraries Achieving More (SLAM)
description: A partnership between Durham Public Schools and the Durham County Library that gives DPS students and staff access to library cards and digital/print resources.

name: HandsOn Triangle
description: A large Triangle-area volunteer opportunity database where you can browse roles by date, interest, organization, and community need.

name: Student Action Board
description: A leadership-focused service program where students identify local needs, plan service projects, and build teamwork and community impact skills.

name: Habitat for Humanity of Durham
description: Volunteer opportunities supporting affordable housing projects in Durham, including build days, site support, and community-based events.

name: Teen Board Sponsored Habitat for Humanity of Durham
description: A teen leadership group (roughly ages 14–18) that supports youth builds, mentoring, advocacy, and community engagement projects.

name: SEEDs Volunteering
description: Volunteer with SEEDs by submitting the volunteer form to help with community garden and environmental projects.

name: Church World Service (CWS) Durham
description: Volunteer with refugee and immigrant support efforts through direct services, advocacy, and community connection programs in Durham.

name: Communities Acting for Refugee Empowerment (CARE)
description: A community support program that pairs refugee individuals and families with local groups that help with education, goals, and long-term stability.

name: Model UN Week
description: An event introducing how Model UN builds global awareness, civic engagement, and communication skills through simulation-based learning.

name: Women Build Sponsored Habitat for Humanity
description: A hands-on build and fundraising initiative that supports affordable housing while creating a supportive space for women volunteers and advocates.

name: Invasive Plant Removal at Wrightwood Park
description: A local environmental restoration event focused on removing invasive species and helping improve habitat health at Wrightwood Park.

name: IMPACT CAMP
description: A week-long local summer service experience designed for high school students, combining community work with reflection and teamwork.

name: YMCA Triangle
description: A community organization offering youth development, wellness, and family programs across the Triangle, including classes and activities.

name: Mayor’s Award
description: A recognition program for students who complete 60+ volunteer hours over summer break; application typically opens in spring and closes in fall.

name: Commissioners’ Award
description: An award recognizing high volunteer commitment during summer break; students submit hours during the application window for consideration.

name: Governor's and Key Volunteer Service Awards
description: A volunteer recognition program where county selections may advance for statewide recognition; top volunteers may receive additional honors.

name: NCSSM Online
description: A collection of virtual learning opportunities from NCSSM, including full courses and enrichment experiences like math circles and inquiry-based academic exploration offered during the school year.

name: Duke Pre-College Programs
description: A variety of Duke-hosted summer programs that help students strengthen academic skills through interactive learning, teamwork, and exposure to new fields of study.

name: NCSSM Connect
description: Real-time, instructor-led NCSSM courses delivered through partner high schools, often provided at no cost to enrolled students.

name: Chapel Hill Math Circle
description: A collaborative math enrichment program where students tackle advanced concepts and challenging problems in a group setting, typically meeting twice each month.

name: Durham Tech Dual Enrollment
description: College-level coursework options that allow qualified high school students to earn college credit while completing their high school education, with eligibility requirements depending on the pathway.

name: Wake Tech Dual Enrollment
description: A tuition-free program that enables eligible high school students to earn college credits or workforce credentials, often counting toward both high school graduation and future college goals.

name: Teen Science Cafe
description: An informal evening event for teens featuring conversations with STEM professionals, hands-on activities, and a relaxed environment designed to spark curiosity and exploration.

name: NCSSM Summer Accelerator
description: An intensive summer learning experience offering challenging STEM-focused courses taught by experts, where students collaborate with peers and engage in real-world applications.

name: NCSSM Summer Ventures
description: A fully funded summer program for academically strong North Carolina students that emphasizes hands-on research, university-level learning, and exploration of STEM career paths.

name: NCSSM INSPIRE
description: A research-focused summer program that introduces students from diverse backgrounds to STEM fields while building leadership skills and experience solving complex, real-world challenges.

name: EXPLORE@UNC
description: A one-week residential program that allows high school students to experience college life, sample academic subjects, and reflect on potential majors and career interests.

name: NC State Engineering Residential Camps
description: A residential summer experience where students live on campus at NC State while exploring a specific engineering discipline through hands-on projects and college-style learning.

name: NC State Engineering Day Camps
description: Week-long, non-residential engineering camps that introduce younger high school students to how engineers approach problem-solving across multiple disciplines.

name: UNC Chapel Hill Dual Enrollment
description: Eligible honor roll high school juniors may apply to take UNC summer courses as visiting students through the university’s Summer School program.
